Description: A bacterial disease that causes black spots on leaves and fruit.
Why it occurred: Caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria.
Prevention measures: Plant resistant varieties and avoid overwatering.

Description: A fungal disease that causes brown spots on leaves.
Why it occurred: Caused by the fungus Alternaria solani.
Prevention measures: Plant resistant varieties and avoid overwatering.
Recommended steps to cure the disease: Apply a fungicide such as copper or chlorothalonil.

Description: A virus that causes yellow or green mosaics on leaves.
Why it occurred: Caused by the tomato mosaic virus.
Prevention measures: Plant resistant varieties and control aphid vectors.

Description: A mite that sucks the sap from tomato leaves, causing them to turn yellow and die.
Why it occurred: Caused by the mite Tetranychus urticae.
Prevention measures: Plant resistant varieties, avoid overwatering, and control weeds.
Recommended steps to cure the disease: Apply an insecticide such as neem oil or insecticidal soap.

Description: A virus that causes yellowing and curling of leaves.
Why it occurred: Caused by the tomato yellow leaf curl virus.
Prevention measures: Plant resistant varieties and control whitefly vectors.
Recommended steps to cure the disease: There is no cure for tomato yellow leaf curl virus. Infected plants should be removed and destroyed.
